result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Larry Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees (if not previously done so as to DNA fees) up to 25% of prison  funds.  Balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full time/part time employment and/or schooling.
Mental health assessment and treatment.  Take all prescribed medications.
Particpate in a cognitive thinking program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department and/or agent.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens with no positive results.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.

supervisions.notes:
If not previously done so, defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon:   defendant shall never be in possession of  any firearms or weapons; can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Larry Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment resent to defendant at Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, returned copy received on April 29, 2016 in file.
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, defendant's copy returned for insuffcient address unable to forward.

Signed and filed on 4-19-16: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  

The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Written reasons attached./dds

*copy to defendant and district attorney*
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.    

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 42 MONTHS, with credit for 87 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Programs.
 
CONDITIONS  OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION ARE AS FOLLOWS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees (if not previously done so, as to the DNA fees) up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  If not previously done so, Defendant is required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participated in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Leon Larry Walker in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leon Larry Walker in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM MSDF FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, Defendant Leon Larry Walker not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for James C. Griffin for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from MSDF for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Leon Larry Walker in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Leon Larry Walker in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
